page.title: 18EDUCATION
page.content: Elworth Hall County Primary School is the newest of the four primary schools in the area.The other three schools are more 'formal' in design whilst Elworth Hall is an 'open -plan'building of echelon design and was opened in 1977. There are approximately 160 children in the school and seven members of staff i.e. six class teachers and the headteacher.The other three primary schools vary slightly in size e.g. the largest has about 240 pupils and nine members of staff. The six classes at Elworth Hall include three infant and three junior classes.In order to limit class sizes certain groups have mixed age bands e.g.the oldest group consists of 8 third-year and 20 fourth-year juniors. The largest class size in the school is at present 32 children.
